Never get tired of this game. It shows its age with the graphics, but the gameplay really shines. If you're into modding, this game has thousands of mods out, and Valve even provides the tools to make your own. It's worth a buy, and you'll find it to be a staple in your steam library. The multiplayer, while basic, is fast paced and fun. The ultimate 90s FPS.

Now, to be honest, I do have a few nitpicks with some bugs, and I don't adore the game yet (I say yet because I've played through it once and haven't modded it), but I think this is a must-play regardless. Gameplay is insanely fun, the story is really intriguing especially when you get deep into it, looks great despite its age, some intelligent puzzles, great boss fights, a vast amount of enemies, what else could you ask for???

Puzzles are very crafty, but I find some of them to be either buggy or have some stupid way of figuring out the solution.

For gameplay, there is a varied way of approaching fights, but for the most part the game is pretty much linear (which is okay), however once you get to Xen shit goes baller with the boost jump, platforming, and slew of new enemies, which help to really vary the gameplay!

Yes, it looks outdated, but I think it's great looking for the style. That's also why Black Mesa exists.

Characters are charming, especially the scientists which are hilarious, and add more to the game than you'd think.

This game is a 9.5/10 for me. It has so much to it despite a few annoying bugs, and while you may not love it at first, I bet if you play it more than once it'll grow on you
It's a fun classic, play it.

Half-Life is a great game. Easily one of my favorite games of all time and I only started playing it this year. The main game is great. I love running through the halls of the Black Mesa Research Facility and blasting aliens and HECU grunts. The only parts of the game I could really do without are On A Rail and the majority of Interloper. Xen in general was kind of an anticlimactic disappointment after the downright amazing game before it. When you start playing Xen, you wish you were back in the Black Mesa Facility and that feeling never goes away even after you defeat Nihilanth. Speaking of Nihilanth, I found the fight to be way too easy. Nihilanth does next to nothing except for use cheap attacks that can kill you even if you're at full health. I would've preferred a much more interesting fight for a final boss but when it was over, there was still a great sense of accomplishment. Everything before Xen is great but Xen itself is mediocre. I love this game to death and the online multiplayer adds to that. The multiplayer is very fun and I'm online most days due to the multiplayer. I've replayed the campaign for a second time partially and I'm loving it all over again. Valve made an excellent product when they released Half-Life. It's just too much fun to stay away from for long.

In short, 8.5/10 would highly recommend regardless of whether or not it's on sale. I'd say $10.00 is way too low for Half-Life. I would've gladly paid more for it.
one of the games of all time

Literally played this game that I've already beat on the Source version just to check out the amazing new feature of being able to exit back to the main menu while in the singleplayer campaign. Best update ever, would spend £7.19 again just to exit out to the main menu.

What is there to say that hasn't already been said? One of the greatest singleplayer FPS of all time. A timeless classic that I thoroughly enjoy playing through once a year. Playing smart in this game makes you feel like an actual theoretical physicist, and it encourages you to do so at many points. Fantastic game all around 10/10

So, it's Half-Life. It's a great game and everything, but I don't think so. Long, annoying puzzles are most of this game, and I LIKE puzzles! But having to spend 15 minutes just to run over to some stupid generator and back is NOT fun. I think the shooting kinda sucks. Even though the aiming is fine, it's just not satisfying to kill enemies. (Or scientists.)

Unbroken (mostly) first person narrative that's still impressive today.
Gun play can be a bit weak but its still very technically sound.
It's worth playing If you're at all interested in the development of FPS games.

This game is in my favorites section.

Such a classic. This is a FPS where no one holds your hand to show you what you have to do and where is the next checkpoint, but instead, is built in such a way where you will be able to figure it out yourself. 

It's a must if you want to understand the history of FPS video games. 

Sadly, Half Life 2 is nowhere near as good as Half Life 1.

it started off a a Quake mod and then evolved to become a new standered in gaming and storytelling in games. it is a very addictive game. the only major drawback is that sometimes it wont fully close when im done so it makes it look like i have more hours on than i do. i am only about halfway through the game and i havent even gotten to the expansions yet. theres also a cool little multiplayer on here i play every now and again. yeah it hasnt aged the best graphicly (most early 3D games havent but i have a soft spot for them anyway) but still its a must play for a reason. it is impressive for the time and still kinda impressive today. yeah theres a lot of loading zones but still its a fun romp for what its worth. i got the base game and the 2 expansions for like $14 so i cant really complain. its worth the money (i may be a bit biased as i do quite enjoy games like Doom and Duke and stuff though) if you like the second game you will like this game. even so theres still Black Mesa if you want a slightly different expierence.
